newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turk shares extend losses on opposition comments.
newsitem.headline: Turk shares extend losses on opposition comments.

text.p: Istanbul shares extended morning losses in selling prompted by escalating political worries at the start of the afternoon session, brokers said.

They said remarks by Mesut Yilmaz, Turkey's main opposition party leader that he was in full agreement with a dissident government deputy on forming a secularist coalition caused fears over the future of the shaky Islamist-led coalition to increase.
The IMKB National-100 stood at 1,365 at 1135, down 30 points, or 2.15 percent from Monday. It was down 1.29 percent in thin trade in the morning session.

"The expectation of an alternative government to replace the current one is about to develop in the market. If talks on a secularist alliance produce a positive outcome, the market may quickly recover," said Hasan Soydan from Garanti securities.
"But the index may remain in tight ranges for today," he added.
Brokers said volume was extremely thin as players kept to the sidelines amid caution.
